metadata.name: AD Privileged Users or Groups Reconnaissance
metadata.comment: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM user_access WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (metadata.event_code = 4661 AND (exists(observables, x -> lower(x.type) in ('sam_user', 'sam_group'))) AND (exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-512'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-502'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-500'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-505'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-519'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-520'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-544'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-551'))) OR exists(observables, x -> endswith(lower(x.name), lower('-555')))) AND exists(observables, x -> contains(lower(x.name), lower('admin'))) AND NOT endswith(lower(actor.user.name), lower('$')))

output.summary: Detect priv users or groups recon based on 4661 eventid and known privileged users or groups SIDs

metadata.objective: False positive: If source account name is not an admin then its super suspicious Reference: https://web.archive.org/web/20230329163438/https://blog.menasec.net/2019/02/threat-hunting-5-detecting-enumeration.html
